The S&P 500 closed essentially flat at 6,449.15, down just 0.01%, while the Nasdaq gained 0.01% to 23,713.76 on Monday's trading session.

Google increased stake from 8% to 14%, providing additional $1.4B investment

Dayforce emerged as the top S&P 500 performer, surging 23% on acquisition speculation involving private equity firm Thoma Bravo targeting the human-resources management software provider 8. Flexsteel Industries jumped 19.2% following earnings results 2. TeraWulf gained over 10% after Google expanded its investment by $1.4B, increasing its stake to 14% and bringing total investment to approximately $3.2B to fund expansion of the Lake Mariner facility in New York 7. The agreement solidifies TeraWulf's strategic alignment with Google for advanced AI infrastructure development, with shares rising roughly 90% over the past week following two 10-year computing deals with AI cloud provider Fluidstack.

IDEXX Laboratories led declines with a 1.99% drop to $637.86, despite maintaining strong YTD gains of 39.79% 4. Biogen fell 1.94% to $135.91, extending YTD losses to 32.60% amid ongoing biotechnology sector challenges. Invitation Homes declined 1.93% to $29.95, reflecting continued pressure in the real estate sector with YTD losses of 13.04%.

          Earnings-Driven Moves
        
Post-earnings momentum drove significant moves across multiple names. Palo Alto Networks gained 5.1% with CyberArk rising 4.1% in sympathy, while Fabrinet dropped 8.4% on disappointing results 2. Evolent Health declined 4.7% following announcement of a convertible stock offering, highlighting ongoing dilution concerns affecting equity valuations.
